verses.roman:
vastutaḥ prabhu yabe kailā āliṅgana
tāṅra sparśe gandha haila candanera sama

synonyms: vastutaḥ—in fact; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; yabe—when; kailā—did; āliṅgana—embracing; tāṅra sparśe—by His touch; gandha haila—there was a fragrance; candanera sama—exactly like that of sandalwood pulp.
translation: In fact, however, when Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu embraced the body of Sanātana Gosvāmī, by the Lord's touch alone there was manifest a fragrance exactly like that of sandalwood pulp.
